review: I have a Plasma TV and a Smart TV.  The Plasma TV is used in a family room close to my router.  The Smart TV is used in the basement, at a greater distance away from the router.I have a Roku 3, which I have used with the Plasma TV for approximately one year.  Connection time is quick, and reception is excellent on all my Roku channels.Two weeks ago, I purchased a Roku 3500R Streaming Stick to use with the Smart TV.  Although the Smart TV is located in the basement at some distance from the router, connection time is quick, and reception is excellent with all the built-in Smart TV channels (Netflix, Amazon Prime, HBO etc.).  However, I purchased the Roku stick in order to gain access to additional channels not included among the built-in Smart TV channels.  Unlike the excellent reception of Smart TV channels, the reception of Roku channels is extremely poor.  Netflix will connect, but the wait time is lengthy, and there is considerable buffering during play.  Amazon Prime will not connect at all.  That is not a problem, because I can watch Netflix and Amazon Prime as Smart TV channels with quick connection and excellent reception.  However, I purchased the Roku stick to gain access to other channels, available only through Roku, and I cannot access them.I tested my Roku 3 with the Smart TV in the basement, and reception is very good; although, as expected, not as good as with the Plasma TV in the family room, closer to the router.I then tested the Roku stick with my Plasma TV in the family room, and reception of Roku channels was acceptable, though markedly poorer than the reception of those channels using the Roku 3 with the Plasma TV.As a result of these tests, I have concluded that the Roku stick must be far less powerful than the Roku 3.  In any event, the Roku stick is useless to my family.  Since most of our viewing occurs in the family room, we need our best reception there, and so we will continue to use the Roku 3 in the family room.  We also watch television in the basement, but we must rely on the built-in Smart TV channels, rather than the Roku stick.  When we want to view Roku channels that are not built-in Smart TV channels, we must do so in the family room.I hope this review is useful to someone.
